item.title: NBA 2K25: 5 Best Playbooks
item.description:
An NBA team is only as good as the plays they run. They can have some of the best players in the league, but without running the proper plays, they won't be very successful. This applies to NBA 2K25 as well. Knowing which plays can best help bring your team to life can be the key difference between victory and defeat. This is why some of the best teams in the history of the NBA have some of the best playbooks.

Luckily, the game brings a ton of these playbooks for players to choose from. This way, players won't have to worry about constructing the perfect playbook for themselves, though that is still possible. This guide is here to lay out which playbooks are the best options for players to bring with them as they create their perfect roster and players.

5 1986 Celtics Playbook

Good Movement And Shooting Opportunities

  • Plenty of movement to keep plays fun.
  • Covers plenty of ranges to score.
  • Offers some money plays that can dominate an opponent.

The Celtics dominated the 80sm for a reason and this playbook shows players exactly why. It gives players plenty of scoring options from just about any range, and has a good amount of movement to keep things interesting . It can spread the defense out to create any kind of play you could want.

Using this playbook will make sure that players can get their shooters open through either passing or isolation plays . Gamers can expect to find plenty of plays that work for them regardless of if they are going for a three-pointer or even posting up down low.

4 1987 Lakers Playbook

Bring Showtime To The Court

  • Plenty of diversity.
  • Offers lots of movement to keep things going.
  • Use a star point guard to bring this to the next level.

Alongside the Celtics, the Lakers saw an incredible run in the 80s with the likes of Magic Johnson and Kareem Abdul-Jabbar leading the way. This playbook brings the best of that team to life through a diverse array of plays that can help players get the right people open.

Further, if the talent of the point guard can meet that of Magic Johnson, this playbook can truly shine . Much of the Lakers' success in the 80s was because Johnson proved why he is one of the best point guards in history. Doing the same means that players can expect the same results.

3 1996 Bulls Playbook

One Of The Most Dominant Teams

  • There's a reason this team won three championships in a row.
  • Creates a ton of scoring using the triangle offense.
  • Still enough variety.

The Bulls had a dynasty in the 90s for a reason, and their playbook from 1996 shows exactly why. While the book is designed to give plenty of isolation opportunities for Jordan, there are also a handful of games that offer others the chance to shine. Utilizing Phil Jackson's famous Triangle Offense, this playbook has some great movement and opens up the court for scoring from any position. It makes sense to have one of the playbooks for one of the greatest teams in NBA history.

2 2001 Laker Playbook

Sheer Dominance

  • One of the best offenses in modern history.
  • Full of diverse plays.
  • Easy scoring.

There's not much that can be said about the 2001 Lakers that hasn't already been said by countless people. The team was incredible, using the talent of Kobe Bryant and Shaq to their full potential. They won the championship due to skill and the right plays being called.

This playbook offers a good set of plays that can make scoring easy . There are plays for isolation to feed the hot hand, while some that offer pick and roll action to get by a defender.

1 2013 Heat Playbook

Become A Superteam

  • Diverse array of plays
  • Dominant scoring
  • Easy to learn

The 2013 Heat was something else, offering electric scoring and just dominant play . Erik Spoelstra dialed up an incredible playbook that used his players to their full effect. This included sharp shooting from Dwyane Wade, physical dominance from LeBron James, and incredible inside play from Chris Bosh. Using this playbook is pretty easy to understand, and it can work for a variety of different teams and their compositions. It's easy to learn and can make your team so much better .

item.title: Best Open-World Games To Play If You Love Taking Photos
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Capture breathtaking landscapes in beloved games like The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild.
  • Horizon: Zero Dawn offers a built-in Photo Mode with different weather scenarios for diverse snapshots.
  • Ghost of Tsushima provides realistic physics and beautiful Japanese landscapes to immortalize with photos.

Photography is one of the finest arts in the world, as it has allowed people to record pieces of history and beautiful moments ever since it was invented. While it's always better to experience things first-hand, having a snapshot of an iconic moment is priceless—and with the Photo Mode in many open-world games, that's now possible in players' favorite titles.

Whether it is a nice horseback ride with a beautiful sunset in the back or an epic battle to the death between two mortal enemies, being able to take pictures is a great feature to have, and players who love taking photos can enjoy it as much as playing the game and exploring every other aspect of it. Here are the best open worlds for photography lovers to play .

5 The Legend Of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild

Capture Every Moment In Link's Journey

  • Breathtaking views of Hyrule
  • Players must get the camera Rune to be able to take photos

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild is famous for its beautiful landscapes across the kingdom of Hyrule. There are high towers, large green areas, mysterious ruins and tons of fantastical elements that players can enjoy and take photos of. To take photos in the game, players will first have to obtain the precious camera Rune, which isn't too hard to come by and is well worth it.

Elements like the game's dynamic weather system change the scenery's lighting, affecting how photos look when they're taken. Link can take advantage of the various vantage points and cliffs to capture the perfect moment and keep the picture for reminiscing in the years to come.

4 Horizon: Zero Dawn

Take Beautiful Snapshots Of A Post-apocalyptic World

  • Different weather presents a great opportunity to snap various kinds of photographs
  • Beautiful graphics set the scene for Photo Mode and all the possibilities it offers

Set in a post-apocalyptic version of Earth, centuries after technologically advanced humans destroyed one another, Horizon: Zero Dawn presents the ideal scenery for a wide range of different photographically-oriented opportunities. One of the most interesting visual aspects of this game is the incredible contrast between a world that's mostly been reclaimed by nature and the mechanical animals that inhabit it.

As opposed to The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild , this title does not require players to unlock a specific ability or item to be able to take photos, as the Photo Mode is already built in from the start of the story. Guerrilla Games did an outstanding job with the game's graphics, which, in turn, results in players being able to take wonderful photos without having to struggle too much to find the right angle or thing to capture. Horizon: Zero Dawn also has great weather variety, so players have a wide range of options between warm, sunny weather, and snowy, cold environments to choose from.

3 Ghost Of Tsushima

Immortalize An Epic Duel Between Two Enemies

  • Tsushima Island has beautiful natural landscapes
  • The game's particle and vegetation physics provide a more realistic look to the pictures taken

Most people who've ever watched an anime or a documentary filmed in Japan know how beautiful the country is and how perfect its landscapes are for taking amazing photographs that could win a contest. Ghost of Tsushima is the perfect representation of the real-life Japanese island of Tsushima in terms of its rich vegetation, open environments, and beautiful green prairies. There's also traditional Japanese architecture that is not only historically accurate but also a great complement to the title's overall appearance.

One of the things that make Ghost of Tsushima great is how realistic its particle effects and vegetation movements are, reacting with the wind in a very believable and natural way. This, along with the great horseback riding physics and the game's detailed graphics make for the perfect photography setting that players can take advantage of through the built-in Photo Mode feature. Whether players choose to take pictures of Tsushima's beautiful natural landscapes, a small town, or an epic standoff between Jin Sakai and an enemy, one thing's for sure—there will always be a nearly endless set of possibilities.

2 Red Dead Redemption 2

The Wild West Offers The Perfect Scenery For Photography

  • Photo Mode allows players to capture both calm moments in nature, and adrenaline-rushing shootouts
  • The game offers a large variety of sceneries, from mountainous regions to massive cities

For decades, the Wild West has been the favorite setting for storytellers, moviemakers, and photographers to create art that the general population has frequently loved and enjoyed. Red Dead Redemption 2 is not only regarded by players as one of the greatest games Rockstar has ever released, but one of the greatest games of all time. This is due to its incredible story, amazing game mechanics, vast open world, and, of course, complete Photo Mode.

Red Dead Redemption 2 's map is so big, that players can explore a big part of US territory from that era. From the French-influenced city of Saint Denis (based on real-life New Orleans), to the mountainous regions of Valentine, which is said to be modeled after Valentine, Nebraska, players will never have a shortage of locations to use as scenery. Depending on players' preferences, they might opt to use Photo Mode to take pictures of Arthur Morgan as he rides through US territory on horseback, or to capture heart-racing moments where bullets are flying through the air.

Whatever the case, one thing's for sure—photo lovers will have a lot of fun playing Red Dead Redemption 2 and taking advantage of the game's detailed Photo Mode.

1 The Witcher 3

Killing Monsters And Capturing Moments Can Go Hand In Hand

  • Variety of settings, including open prairies, bogs, and huge cities
  • Players can take pictures in combat to capture epic moments

The Witcher 3 is arguably one of the best open-world RPGs set in medieval times, and certainly the best installment in the franchise so far. Not only does this title have the right amount of fantasy, but it also has an incredible story that works well with all the side quests available and its two wonderful DLCs. Both horseback riding and on-foot exploration feel very exciting, and the combat game mechanics are very well-designed, offering enough control for skilled players to be able to complete the game in Death March, the hardest difficulty available.

All this is complemented by an amazing Photo Mode that photography lovers can take advantage of, regardless of where they are in the game or what situation they find themselves in. The Witcher 3 has beautiful sceneries packed with dirt roads, green prairies, enormous cities, and even creepy caves and witch-ridden bogs. Whether players want to photograph Geralt navigating through the packed streets of Novigrad or fighting for his life in the eerie von Everec estate, they will always have tons of photographic options at their disposal.

item.title: 8 More Games Confirm PS5 Pro Upgrades
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • The PS5 Pro offers significant performance enhancements, but comes with a $699.99 price tag.
  • 21 games are now confirmed to be getting PS5 Pro upgrades.

Sony has updated its list of games that are getting PlayStation 5 Pro upgrades. The upcoming PlayStation 5 Pro boasts a hefty price tag, but for some, it may be worth the investment. For a whopping $699.99, the PlayStation 5 Pro offers gamers significant performance enhancements, like letting them play games at 60 frames per second while not sacrificing graphical fidelity.

The PS5 Pro has been hugely controversial since it was first announced. Many fans balked at the PS5 Pro's super high price, though it's worth pointing out that it's not the most expensive PlayStation console when adjusted for inflation. Others came around a bit when they saw the PS5 Pro's 30th Anniversary edition. It will be interesting to see how well the PS5 Pro does when it's all said and done, and if enough games get PS5 Pro-specific upgrades to justify buying it.

21 games have been confirmed to be getting a PS5 Pro upgrade at the time of this writing, with eight new ones just announced during the latest PlayStation State of Play event. Joining the previously-confirmed games getting a PS5 Pro upgrade are Dragon Age: The Veilguard , F1 24 , Ghost of Tsushima: Director's Cut , Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater , Resident Evil 4 , Resident Evil Village , Star Wars Jedi: Survivor , and Stellar Blade . Presumably, all of these PS5 Pro upgrades will be available once the console launches on November 7, though that wasn't specified.

All Games Getting PS5 Pro Upgrades

  • Alan Wake 2
  • Assassin’s Creed Shadows
  • Demon’s Souls (2020)
  • Dragon Age: The Veilguard
  • Dragon’s Dogma 2
  • F1 24
  • Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth
  • Ghost of Tsushima
  • Gran Turismo 7
  • Hogwarts Legacy
  • Horizon Forbidden West
  • Marvel’s Spider-Man 2
  • Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater
  • Ratchet & Clank: Rift Apart
  • Resident Evil 4
  • Resident Evil Village
  • Star Wars Jedi: Survivor
  • Stellar Blade
  • The Crew Motorfest
  • The First Descendant
  • The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered

Sony confirmed the PS5 Pro upgrades in a sizzle reel that showcased the previously-confirmed titles with the new batch of games coming to the system. The trailer made clear that the new console will definitely let players get the most out of their games, but the jury is still out on whether the upgrades justify the PS5 Pro's incredibly high price point.

Sony has promised that even more games are getting PS5 Pro upgrades in the future, though they have yet to be revealed. For now, PlayStation gamers only have these 21 games to go by when making their decisions about buying a PS5 Pro or not.

item.title: PlayStation 5 Reveals Chroma Collection for Controllers and Consoles
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • PlayStation introduces the new Chroma Collection for PS5 with vibrant color options like Indigo, Teal, and Pearl.
  • Pre-orders for Chroma Collection controllers and console covers start on October 3, priced at $64.99 for covers and $79.99 for controllers.
  • Fans can mix and match PS5 hardware cosmetics with the Chroma Collection, adding a customizable touch to their gaming experience.

PlayStation has revealed a brand-new Chroma Collection for PS5 controllers and consoles, giving players fresh customization options for their gaming hardware. The PS5 has seen a number of exclusive controller and console cover releases, with the recent limited-edition Astro Bot controller ranking among the most popular, and audiences can now enjoy even more colorful options for their PS5.

Following the recent announcement of the PlayStation 30th Anniversary Collection, fans are once again being treated to a new lineup of cosmetics for their PS5 consoles and controllers. With competitors like Xbox and Nintendo offering a variety of color variants for their respective consoles, it should come as no surprise that PlayStation wants to keep fans invested with its own eye-catching hardware options.

Fans will soon be able to pre-order the Chroma Collection series of controllers and console covers for the PlayStation 5. Available color options include Indigo, Pearl, and Teal. Pre-orders for the PS5 Chroma Collection will begin on October 3, with the Indigo and Pearl options releasing November 7, 2024, and the Teal varieties launching January 23, 2025. The console covers will retail at $64.99 while the Chroma DualSense controllers will be $79.99. As many players contemplate potentially upgrading to the PlayStation 5 Pro console, others are delighted to see that they can make new aesthetic improvements to their existing PS5 set-ups.

PlayStation 5 Chroma Collection

  • Chroma Indigo PS5 Console Covers (November 7)
  • Chroma Indigo DualSense Wireless Controller (November 7)
  • Chroma Pearl PS5 Console Covers (November 7)
  • Chroma Pearl DualSense Wireless Controller (November 7)
  • Chroma Teal PS5 Console Covers (January 25, 2025)
  • Chroma Teal DualSense Wireless Controller (January 25, 2025)

Taking a look at the vibrant offerings in the Chroma Collection, fans can enjoy a beautiful selection of iridescent colors. The Indigo option features a shimmering purple and blue combination, while the Teal showcases a mixture of lighter and darker shades of green. For fans wanting a sleek aesthetic for their PS5, the Pearl offers a blend of pale pinks and creams with light gray detailing. Each of the controllers and console covers in the PS5 Chroma Collection will be sold separately, allowing players to mix and match their hardware cosmetics as they please. Whether looking to pick up a brand-new PlayStation 5 DualSense controller or simply add fresh console covers to the PS5, the Chroma Collection has fun options for players to look forward to.

As customization options in video games have grown as a key selling point for fans, the ability to alter the cosmetics of the hardware those titles are played on has also become more popular. With offerings such as the exclusive Astro Bot controller, the 30th Anniversary Collection, and now the Chroma Collection, PlayStation seems keen on helping fans get the most out of their PS5 gaming experience.

item.title: Horizon Zero Dawn PS5 Remaster is Official
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered for PS5 & PC out 10/31.
  • Features 10+ hours of re-recorded motion capture.
  • Granular control over accessibility features.

Horizon Zero Dawn is officially being remastered for both the PlayStation 5 and PC. Featuring a graphical update that brings the game up to the level of its sequel, Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered is available worldwide on October 31.

When it was first released in 2017 for PlayStation 4 – and in 2020 for PC – Horizon Zero Dawn began a brand-new sci-fi franchise centered on Aloy, a quick-thinking huntress of the Nora tribe. Fans explored the apocalyptic ruins of the United States as they uncovered the truth behind the end of the old world, saving the new one in the process. The game received a sequel in the form of Horizon Forbidden West in 2022, with a third and assumedly final Horizon entry expected to be revealed in the next couple of years.

However, it seems like players will have the chance to experience the series’ beginning in a whole new way well before that. During the recent Sony State of Play, Guerrilla Games officially revealed Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered is coming to both PlayStation 5 and PC on October 31. This revamped version of the original game features hours of re-recorded motion capture, graphical fidelity on par with Horizon Forbidden West , and improvements to take full advantage of modern PC and PlayStation 5 features to enhance both visuals and performance.

Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered for PlayStation 5 and PC

  • Over 10 hours of re-recorded conversational motion capture
  • Same visual fidelity as Horizon Forbidden West
  • Accessibility features from Horizon Forbidden West
  • Save game compatibility with the original
  • Available worldwide on October 31
    • Full game: $50
    • Upgrade from the original Horizon Zero Dawn : $10

The remastered version of Horizon Zero Dawn will also include accessibility features introduced in Horizon Forbidden West , including remappable controls, haptic cues, and assist toggles. What’s more, the remaster can read old save data, meaning players can pick up in the new version of Horizon Zero Dawn exactly where they left off in the original. Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered will also be available on PlayStation 5 Pro when it releases on November 7.

Fans who already own the original Horizon Zero Dawn can upgrade to the digital version of the remaster for $10 – players who own the physical version can even do so by inserting the disc into their PlayStation 5 consoles. Those who don’t have it yet can instead buy the full game for $50 through the PlayStation Store, Epic Game Store, or Steam.

Were that not exciting enough, LEGO Horizon Adventures – a light-hearted spin-off of the main series – is coming out on November 14, just a couple of weeks after Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered . These two new releases are certain to be great refreshers ahead of Horizon 3 and its likely conclusion of Aloy’s epic adventure.
